blogs.title: Apple discontinues the 27-inch iMac
blogs.description: You're out of luck if you were hoping for a larger, brawnier counterpart to the M1 iMac. Apple has discontinued the 27-inch iMac, leaving last year's 24-inch M1 model as the only all-in-one in the lineup. If you want to buy a higher-end (but relatively compac…

blogs.title: Here’s everything Apple announced at its ‘Peek Performance’ event

blogs.title: Apple turns monitor height adjustment into a $400 upsell
blogs.description:
Apple unveiled a new standalone monitor—the $1599 Studio Display
—that includes your choice of either a tilt-adjustable stand or a VESA wall mount adaptor. But for $400 more, you can purchase a fancier tilt and height-adjustable version of that stand. In the…

blogs.title: Bitcoin spikes 8% after apparent release of Yellen statement on Biden's crypto executive order - CNB
blogs.description: The U.S. Treasury published then took down a statement on an unreleased executive order on digital assets which appeared supportive of cryptocurrencies.

blogs.title: Costco, Sam's Club battle for gas dominance - Fox Business
blogs.description: The national average for a gallon of regular gasoline reached $4.173 as of Tuesday, climbing 50 cents from a week earlier, according to AAA data.

blogs.description: Putin's unpredictable Ukraine gambit has offered a wake-up call to the wisdom of an all-hands-on-deck approach to energy.

blogs.title: UK expands Online Safety Bill to cover scam ads and eyes wider reforms
blogs.description: The UK government has again announced an extension to the scope of the draft Online Safety Bill — this time bringing scam ads into scope following pressure from campaigners. In parallel, it has also launched a consultation on strengthening existing regulation…

blogs.title: Russian Nickel Compounds Pain For Carmakers Contending With Chip Shortages
blogs.description: Putin’s invasion of Ukraine is an unexpected complication for efforts to wean motorists off gasoline and diesel fuel and switch to electric vehicles.
